Container.Name: Subsonic
Container.Description:
Subsonic is an open source, web-based media server. [br][br]
Because Subsonic was written in Java, it may be run on any operating system with Java support. [br] Subsonic supports streaming to multiple clients simultaneously, and supports any streamable media (including MP3, AAC, and Ogg).[br] Subsonic also supports on-the-fly media conversion (through the use of plugins) of most popular media formats, including WMA, FLAC, and more.[br][br]
[b][span style='color: #E80000;']Directions:[/span][/b][br] [b]/subsonic[/b] : set this path to where you wish Subsonic to store it's configuration.[br] [b]/music[/b] : set this path to where you wish Subsonic to search for music.[br] [b]/podcasts[/b] : set this path to where you wish Subsonic to store and share podcasts from.[br] [b]/playlists[/b] : set this path to where you wish Subsonic to store and share playlists from.[br] [br][br] Optional Environment Variables:[br] [b]HTTPS_PORT[/b] : this is the HTTPS port for Subsonic, if set HTTP is disabled not matter its value. [br] [b]HTTP_PORT[/b] : this is the HTTP port for Subsonic, its only effective if SSL_PORT is set to 0. [br] [b]MAX_MEM[/b] : this is the numberic value for the maximum Java heap size. [br] [span style=\'color: #E80000;\']If changing SSL_PORT and WEB_PORT values please ensure you change the maps as well.[/span][br]
